Constructor Detail

Cell

public Cell(Universe output,
            long id,
            java.lang.String origin,
            long parentId,
            long generation,
            int initialEnergy,
            Genome genome)
Constructs a new cell with the given genetic code and other information

Parameters:
output - Universe to receive cell I/O output
id - Cell ID (use simulation.nextCellId() for this simulation's next cell id)
origin - Simulation name of origin (use simulation.getName())
parentId - ID of parent cell or 0 if this cell is introduced
generation - Generation (0 for first/introduced)
initialEnergy - Initial energy level
genome - Genetic code
Method Detail

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string describing this cell

Returns:
String description

setCellSurfaceProtein

public void setCellSurfaceProtein(java.lang.Number cellSurfaceProtein)

Sets the "cell surface protein" object

Typically, this is one of the number classes such as Integer. However, if you wish to do something more elaborate then you can just extend Number and add your own special functionality as well. However, the intValue() method and other Number methods should always return something meaningful.

This typically represents an object or numeric value that the cell can set somehow and that defines it's interaction with other cells or with some aspect of a landscape. For example, in Landscape2D cells can set integer values that control their adhesion/communication/energy transfer properties with respect to one another.

Set this to null to clear this value completely.

Parameters:
cellSurfaceProtein - Cell surface protein object

Returns:
Cell surface protein object or null if none

stateMemory

public int[] stateMemory()

Gets cell state memory

Note that the array returned is not a copy, so any modifications will modify the real state memory for the cell.

Returns:
Cell state memory

origin

public java.lang.String origin()
Gets the simulation that this cell originated from

Returns:
Simulation name of cell's ultimate origin

setMetaInfo

public void setMetaInfo(java.lang.Object key,
                        java.lang.Object value)

Sets a piece of meta info

Meta-info can be used by conditions to store info about cells in an efficient manner without the use of extra maps. Meta-info persists for the life of the cell object.

Parameters:
key - Key for meta info
value - Value (any object)

getMetaInfo

public java.lang.Object getMetaInfo(java.lang.Object key)
Gets a piece of meta info

Parameters:
key - Key for meta info
Returns:
Value or null if not found

removeMetaInfo

public java.lang.Object removeMetaInfo(java.lang.Object key)
Removes a piece of meta info

Parameters:
key - Key to remove
Returns:
Value of key or null if key was not set
